title: Form product details
content_markdown:
Version: 8.3Creatio Financial Services CRM
On this page
In Creatio, a set of product details comprises the complete profile of a product and outlines the rules and properties that govern how it is offered to customers. These details consist of:
* **Customer parameters** : requirements that the customer must meet to be able to purchase the product. Customer parameters include age limitations, working experience, etc.
* **Product features** : static parameters that characterize the product. Product features include product currency, early repayment, etc.
* **Documents package** : the list of documents that the customer must provide to purchase the product. For example, if a customer needs to provide an internal passport, an extract from a salary account, or other documents to purchase a banking product.
Each record on the **Product details** expanded list is a separate set of conditions. A product can have multiple sets of conditions that have different terms, but only one can be active at a time.
## Set up customer parameters​
Example
Set up the following customer parameters:
* Age: 18 to 25 years.
* Residency status: resident.
* Employment status: has been employed for no less than 6 months.
To specify the customer parameters:
1. Go to the **Products** section, create a new product, or **open the needed product page**.
2. **Click** the ![](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/images/Finance_and_Banking/financial_services_8_3_1/finserv_product_catalogue/btn-add-record.png) button on the **Product details** expanded list (Fig. 1). This opens the **Product details** page.
Fig. 1 Add a product condition
![Fig. 1 Add a product condition](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/images/Finance_and_Banking/financial_services_8_3_1/finserv_product_catalogue/sct_bank_product_add_details.png)
3. **Enter the start and end dates** for the product conditions on the **Product details** page.
4. **Click the Add parameter** button on the **Customer parameters** tab.
5. **Select** "Male age, years", for example, in the empty field (Fig 3.).
Fig. 3 Selecting characteristics
![Fig. 3 Selecting characteristics](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/images/Finance_and_Banking/financial_services_8_3_1/finserv_product_catalogue/scr_section_products_choose_men_age.png)
As a result, the **Male age, years** field will appear on the **Customer parameters** tab.
6. Change the view of the value entry field to **enter values** :
1. Pint to the selected value.
2. Click ![](https://academy.creatio.com/docs/sites/default/files/inline-images/btn_products_change_field.png).
3. Select **Value range (minimum/maximum)** (Fig. 4).
Fig. 4 Change the field view
![Fig. 4 Change the field view](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/images/Finance_and_Banking/financial_services_8_3_1/finserv_product_catalogue/scr_section_products_value_range.png)
4. **Enter the required range of values** (Fig. 5).
Fig. 5 Specify a value range
![Fig. 5 Specify a value range](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/images/Finance_and_Banking/financial_services_8_3_1/finserv_product_catalogue/scr_section_products_men_ages.png)
7. **Click the Add parameter** button. Select the **Resident** parameter, for example, and set the value to "Yes" (Fig. 6).
Fig. 6 Specify a Boolean value
![Fig. 6 Specify a Boolean value](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/images/Finance_and_Banking/financial_services_8_3_1/finserv_product_catalogue/scr_section_products_client_resident.png)
8. **Click the Add parameter** button. Select "Working experience, months" and specify "6" in the field that appears to the right, for example (Fig 7).
Fig. 7 Specify a fixed numeric value
![Fig. 7 Specify a fixed numeric value](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/images/Finance_and_Banking/financial_services_8_3_1/finserv_product_catalogue/scr_section_products_total_years.png)
9. **Save changes**.
**As a result** , the specified customer parameters (Fig. 8) will be applied when matching products to applications.
Fig. 8 Example of customer parameters
![Fig. 8 Example of customer parameters](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/images/Finance_and_Banking/financial_services_8_3_1/finserv_product_catalogue/scr_section_products_clieent_characteristic.png)
## Set up product features​
Use the **Product features** tab to set up the static characteristics of a product (Fig. 9).
Fig. 9 Example of a product feature list
![Fig. 9 Example of a product feature list](https://d3a7ykdi65m4cy.cloudfront.net/ac-en/s3fs-public/images/Finance_and_Banking/financial_services_8_3_1/finserv_product_catalogue/cr_section_products_products_features.png)
For example, product features can include repayment conditions, currency, repayment schedule, etc.  
Creating a list of product features is identical to creating a list of the customer’s parameters as described above.
